ref: 1084 *ācchindati, āˊchinatti ʻ cuts off, cuts in pieces ʼ AV., ʻ snatches away ʼ MBh. [√chid]

lang: Language of `Kharoṣṭhī Inscriptions discovered by Sir Aurel Stein in Chinese Turkestan' edited by A. M. Boyer, E. J. Rapson, and E. Senart

ref: Pk. acchiṁdaï ʻ cuts in small pieces, removes forcibly ʼ; O

Si. asin̆danavā ʻ to take away ʼ, caus. asin̆davanavā, mod. ähin̆dinavā ʻ to gather up, pick out, sort (e.g. coffee beans) ʼ. -- Or phonet., but not perh. semant., as well < sáṁchinatti ʻ cuts to pieces ʼ,
